labels.Aliases: Arm Triangle | Side Headlock | Kata Gatame Choke
labels.Description: A choke where the opponent’s arm and head are trapped against the attacker’s shoulder, restricting blood flow to the brain via carotid arteries. Can induce unconsciousness if held.
labels.Biomechanical Mechanism: Action | Lateral compression of neck and arm || Joints Affected | Neck (carotid arteries), shoulder, upper arm || Torque Direction | Side pressure compressing arteries; slight rotation of neck and shoulder stabilizes hold
labels.Position / Entry Examples: From mount | Slide around opponent’s trapped arm, lock head || From guard | Control opponent’s arm, pivot to side || From side control | Underhook arm, drive shoulder into neck || From north-south | Wrap arm around head, apply shoulder pressure || From turtle | Wrap arm, roll into kata gatame
labels.Martial Arts Used In: BJJ | Judo | Jujutsu | Sambo | Submission Grappling | MMA
labels.Danger Rating: Danger: 9/10 | Can render unconscious quickly; requires careful training and tap awareness.
labels.Legality in Competition: IBJJF: Legal (with caution) | Judo: Legal | MMA: Legal | Submission Grappling: Legal
labels.Variants: Classic arm triangle (head-and-arm) || Mounted arm triangle || Side control arm triangle || North-south arm triangle || From turtle to arm triangle roll
labels.Training Notes: Practice slowly; focus on squeezing carotid arteries, not neck vertebrae. Use compliant partners. Ensure quick tap awareness.
labels.History / Origin: Traditional in Judo (Kata Gatame) and later adopted in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu for guard and top control submissions.
labels.Common Mistakes: Head placement too high or low || Insufficient shoulder pressure || Arm not fully trapped || Poor body alignment reduces choke effectiveness
labels.Effectiveness: Extremely effective in both self-defense and competition. Can finish the opponent quickly with proper technique.
labels.Related Techniques: Armbar from guard || Triangle choke || Mounted chokes || North-south choke
labels.Tags: arm triangle | kata gatame | head-and-arm choke | BJJ | Judo | submission grappling | mount submission | side control submission | north-south submission
labels.Notes: Can transition from failed triangle or armbar attempts; commonly chained in positional sequences.
